text: hello my name is yam a Linux clo support
engineer from AWS office in Sydney
Australia today I'm going to show you
how to troubleshoot issues where your
Amazon is2 Linux instance is unreachable
and it's failing its status checks let's
get
started Amazon e to uses three status
checks to monitor the health of E2
instances the system status check the
instance status check and attached EBS
status
check the system status check detects
the issues with instance underlying
Hardware if the underlying Hardware is
unresponsive or unreachable because of
network Hardware or software issues then
system status check fails the issues
that causes the instant status check to
fail includes the
following p to boot operating system
failure to correctly Mount the volumes
exhausted CPU and memory gel Panic
Network failure any significant issues
at voice level can cause the instance to
show status Health
failures attached EBS status check
monitors the Amazon EBS volumes attached
to the instance are reachable and able
to complete IO operations the following
are the examples of issues that can
cause attached EBS status check to fail
Hardware or software issues on storage
subsystems underlying the EBS volumes
hardware issues on the physical host
that impact reachability of EBS volumes
connectivity issue between the instance
and abs
volumes check the status of your E2
instance you can access the instance
status either from the main is2
dashboard or within the is2 dashboard
submenu of the in
you can find the status of instance he
check either looking at the instance
table in the submenu or by selecting the
instance then choosing the status and
alarm
tab system H check failed if the system
H check failed then issue is with the
underlying Hardware you must stop and
start the instance to move instance to
healthy
Hardware note that data that stored in
instance store volumes are lost when the
instance is stopped
before you stop the instance make sure
you back up the data unlike Amazon
elastic Block store back volumes
instance store volumes are epimeral and
don't support data persistence also note
that static public ipv4 address of the
instance on launch or start changes
after you stop and start the instance to
retain public IP V4 address that does
not change when the instance is stopped
you use the elastic IP
address instance head check failed if
instance status check failed check the
instance system locks to identify the
cause of the failure there are several
reasons why instance H check fails if
system locks contains boot errors then
instance cannot boot which causes the
instance H check to fail if the system
locks contains Mount Point failure
errors then instance status check fails
these are the examples of Mount Point
failures when you change the instance
type from Zin to Nitro the volume Mount
might fail Mount failures occurs because
the EBS volumes for Nitro based
instances are exposed as nme blocks the
devices are then renamed as /d/ nme 0 N1
sl/ nm1 N1 and so on rather than Legacy
anden given names as /d/ xvda /d/ xvf
Etc note that the blog device drivers
might assign the nvme device names in a
different order than the order that you
specified in the block device mapping to
avoid mount failes on Nitro based
instances it is best practice to use
either a label or uu ID for device names
if the CPU utilization metrics is not at
or near 100% then the instance does not
have enough compute capacity to run the
Conner this cause instance health check
to fail for bustable instances like T2
T3 instances which are launched with a
standard credit
specification verify the Amazon
cloudwatch CPU credit metrics to see if
the CPU credit are at a near zero if the
CPU credit are at zero then the CP
utilization metrics shows a saturation
limit at the Baseline of resource over
utilization T2 or T3 instances that have
reached saturation shows that status
check failed because of over utilization
block device errors software bugs or
Kernel Panic can cause unusual CPU usage
spikes if CPU utilization is at 100%
first check the system locks for Block
device or memory issues errors or other
unusual system errors then either reboot
or stop and start the
instance High memory pressure can cause
the instant status check failure in the
following example log extract the OS is
out of memory and oam killer is started
to resolve this error stop the process
that consumes the most of the
memory if the system locks contains disk
full errors or no space left errors then
instance is in emergency mode because of
full rout device however there are
instances when the system will boot
normally but subsequently fail its
status he checks note that operating
system does not allow boot to emergency
mode solely due to full
dis Kernel Panic Kernel Panic occurs
when the kernel detects internal fatle
error during operation if the error
occurs during the O boot then kernel
might not load properly this causes OS
boot
failure Network failures can happen for
following reasons missing software if
the piece of the needed software is
missing from Ami image it can prevent
the instance to get its network settings
to get configured correctly
bootstrapping software like Cloud init
takes care of few configuration task
when launching the instances such as
creating network configuration files
needed to get IP address assigned at
boot time other missing Network stack
software like DHCP clients can also
prevent instance to get IP address
assigned if the software is missing for
Amazon Amazon Linux 2 Amazon Linux 2023
or red operating system please run the
command showing on the screen for uban 2
or dbn operating systems please run this
Command hardcoded MAC addresses are in
Linux configuration files and udev
configuration files you can find this
configuration file in the following
locations the IP address is hardcoded in
configuration file when you create the
Amazon machine image Emi from the
instance will statically configured IP
address the configuration file might
contain hardcoded IP address to correct
this error set your network interface to
use DHCP note that you cannot update
existing Amis you must set the network
interface to use DHCP before you create
new
Ami the network interface is
automatically renamed at startup if the
instance type changes there is high
chances the device name as well it is
recommended to check the Kel parameter
configuration to confirm if predictable
network interface naming is enabled to
deactivate predictable network interface
renaming add net. if names equals 0 to
the kernel command
line and now you know how to
troubleshoot issues where you is2 Linux
instance is unreachable and it's failing
its status check thank you for watching
Happy Cloud Computing from all of us
here at AWS
[Music]
